meanings.definition: Done in a way that is intended to escape notice or attention.
meanings.sent1: The furtively cat crept through the shadows, unseen by anyone.
meanings.sent2: She gave a furtively glance around the room before slipping out the door.
meanings.sent3: The furtively squirrel tried to hide its acorn stash from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The furtively movements of the spy were like a ghost in the night.
meanings.sent5: The furtively behavior of the child raised suspicions among the adults.

meanings.definition: In a secretive or sly manner.
meanings.sent1: He looked furtively over his shoulder to make sure no one was following him.
meanings.sent2: The thief furtively pocketed the stolen jewels and disappeared into the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The students furtively passed notes during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The cat moved furtively through the tall grass, stalking its prey.
meanings.sent5: She whispered furtively to her friend, sharing a secret.
